titleStmt.title: Frederick Beaumont an Alfred Escher, s.l., Mittwoch, 23. August 1871

publicationStmt.p: Digitale Briefedition Alfred Escher, Zürich: Alfred Escher-Stiftung.

p.note: Nachträgliche Notiz unten links auf Seite 2 von Eschers Hand: Adresse: | Captain Frederick E. B. Beaumont | Chairman of the Machine Tunnelling Company of London. | (nähere Adresse in London S.Siehe oben.) – Nachträgliche Notiz oben in der Mitte auf Seite 1 von dritter Hand mit roter Farbe: 926 (m.mit 1 Beilage).

body.p:
As the Chairman of the machine tunnelling Company of
London, & also on the part of Mr Monsieur (Herr) Brogden, I beg to submit to
you the following provisional offer for the construction of the
St Gothard tunnel referred to as notre projetsic! direct at page
99 of the rapport technique sur le chemin de fer du St
Gothard.

We will undertake to complete the work in 9 years, & anticipate
being able to do so in 6, we understand that there will be a
fine for delay, while a corresponding premium will be given
for speed.

Not having yet had an opportunity of examining the ground
I am unable at this moment to give you an exact price, but
I may say that our tender for the excavation of the tunnel, will
be very considerably, below the estimate at page 30 of the annexe
to the rapport technique above referred to; for the masonry
I propose to offer at so much per cube metresic!, leaving the quantity
to be put in to the direction of the Engineer.

I may mention that my estimate as to time is based on the supposition
put forward at pages 58 & 59 that the rock is of such a character
that it can be sunk through approximately at the rate of 2 metres
per week & driven horizontally at the rate of 4 metres per week.
The machinery which we shall employ is the block diamond drill,
which from its simple character will enable us to begin operations
in 3 months from the date of the final acceptance of our offer;
the machines may be seen in operation in England where we are exe
cuting with them several important works.

I beg you will be good enough to communicate with me, so soon
as you are prepared to receive a formal offer, when Mr Monsieur (Herr) Brogden
& myself will be ready to fulfill all necessary conditions, & in
doing so please give us sufficient time to enable a proper
study of the ground to be made.

div.p: Thanking you for the civility you have shown me

–Escher E...'
